items.title: Colts WR Mitchell on blown TD, fumble: 'It stings'
items.summary: Colts young WR Adonai Mitchell took ownership of a pair of costly mistakes in Indianapolis' first loss of the season.

items.title: Laiatu Latu Shines with Career Day vs Rams
items.summary: On a day marred by miscues, second-year Indianapolis Colts defensive end Laiatu Latu shined bright in pass rush against Matthew Stafford and this Rams offense. It was a big step that the young pass rusher was expected to take, and although stacking such performances is the next step, this was a fantastic start for Latu. […]

items.title: Colts-Raiders opening odds: Colts look to get back to their winning ways
items.summary: The Indianapolis Colts concluded their two game road trip 1-1, and while it didn’t end exactly as they would have hoped, it does find them at 3-1 on the year. That is a far cry from where many analysts and even fans saw them before the season started. The Colts have a chance to get […]

items.title: Best, worst of NFL Week 4: Packers tie Cowboys in OT thriller, plus Chiefs win big over Ravens
items.summary: Our NFL Nation reporters react to all the action, answering the biggest questions coming out of each game. Here's what we learned from Week 4.

items.title: AD Mitchell’s miscues, Colts’ mistakes played major role in loss to Rams
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS — It was a typical NFL game, this one involving 154 plays. “One play doesn’t define any ballgame,’’ insisted quarterback Daniel Jones Sunday evening at SoFi Stadium in Inglewood, California. But a few of those plays were more consequential than others and were unquestionably defining as Jones and his Indianapolis Colts saw their 3-0 [...]

items.title: Multiple AD Mitchell Mishaps Loom Large in Loss to Rams
items.summary: The Indianapolis Colts had just retaken the lead late in the form of an electric, 76-yard touchdown reception from Daniel Jones to AD Mitchell, except they didn’t. They actually turned the ball over, and it wasn’t anything the Los Angeles Rams defense did. Unfortunately for Colts fans, this is far too familiar a mishap. AD […]

items.title: Colts can’t overcome AD Mitchell’s egregious mistakes in close, 27-20, road loss to Rams
items.summary: There’s the old sports saying that “good teams don’t beat themselves,” but that’s exactly what the Indianapolis Colts did in the second half during a 27-20 tough road loss to the Los Angeles Rams. The main culprit of the late West Coast afternoon loss was talented, but clearly still maturing 2nd-year wideout AD Mitchell—who had […]

items.title: Colts show they can hang with Super Bowl-contending Rams, but left to lament 11 penalties, 3 turnovers in Week 4 loss

items.title: Tyler Warren's versatility shines again with first career touchdown in Colts' Week 4 loss to Rams

items.title: As Adonai Mitchell owns 'unacceptable' mistake, Colts stand by second-year WR: 'One play doesn't define you'
items.summary: Mitchell said he lost focus on his fumble that turned a 76-yard touchdown into possession for the Los Angeles Rams.

items.title: Colts stunned by Rams to suffer first loss in another epic collapse
items.summary: The promising bid for a statement road win unraveled in the second half as the Indianapolis Colts were stunned by the Los Angeles Rams in Sunday’s 27-20 loss at SoFi Stadium. The Colts fell apart once again in perhaps the worst team performance since the late 2024 season collapse at Mile High and the Meadowlands. […]

items.title: Miscues down the Colts against the Rams
items.summary: Stunned. Many moments of frustration and disappointment, but two moments stand out as truly stunning; one beyond belief. The Indianapolis Colts gave everything the Los Angeles Rams could handle and still head home with a loss. It was always going to be a tough game. That was clear from the beginning. A loss here isn’t […]

items.title: Colts lose to Rams, 27-20, drop to 3-1 on the season
items.summary: LOS ANGELES — Mistakes doomed the Colts on Sunday at SoFi Stadium. Indianapolis lost to the Los Angeles Rams, 27-20, and fell short of securing their first 4-0 start to a season since 2009. Miscues from wide receiver Adonai Mitchell negated two Colts touchdowns on the contest. The first of Mitchell's errors came with 11:32 [...]

items.title: Mistakes, penalties send Colts to first defeat of 2025 season

items.title: Colts announce 7 inactive players for Week 4 game vs. Los Angeles Rams

items.title: Opponent Preview: The Los Angeles Rams
items.summary: In the Colts first game outside of the Midwest this season, they take on a Rams coming off of a brutal collapse vs the defending Champion Eagles. The Rams have lost now 3 straight games against the Eagles, including last years playoffs, and are looking for a get-right game against the undefeated Colts. The Rams […]

For Sunday’s road test against the Los Angeles Rams, coach Shane Steichen ruled out wide receiver Alec Pierce (concussion), cornerback Kenny Moore II (Achilles) and right guard Matt Goncalves (toe). items.summary: Tyler Warren has had a hand in two 40+ yard plays while lined up at fullback this season – with those two plays requiring vastly different things from the 2025 first-round pick.

items.title: Your favorite quarterback's favorite quarterback: Colts enter Week 4 with healthy respect for Los Angeles Rams QB Matthew Stafford
items.summary: Los Angeles Rams quarterback Matthew Stafford is in his 17th season in the NFL, and when he takes the field against the Colts on Sunday at SoFi Stadium he'll do with having thrown for 60,548 yards and 382 touchdowns in his spectacular career.

items.title: Colts' Taylor again named AFC Offensive Player of the Week
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – It happened again. For the second week in a row, Indianapolis Colts running back Jonathan Taylor is the AFC Offensive Player of the Week. He’s the first Colts player to earn the honor in back-to-back weeks. The last player to accomplish the feat was Buffalo’s Josh Allen, who was AFC Offensive Player of [...]

items.title: Colts likely without Alec Pierce, Kenny Moore II at Rams
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – The Indianapolis Colts likely will be without two key players as they attempt to remain unbeaten Sunday against the Los Angeles Rams. Wide receiver Alec Pierce is in the NFL’s concussion protocol, while cornerback Kenny Moore II is dealing with an Achilles injury. Neither will practice on Wednesday. That normally is significant with [...]

items.title: Colts RB Jonathan Taylor named AFC Offensive Player of the Week for Week 3
items.summary: Taylor had 17 carries for 102 yards and three touchdowns in the Colts' 41-20 win over the Tennessee Titans.

items.title: Reggie Wayne, Adam Vinatieri headline Colts’ contingent seeking spot in Pro Football Hall of Fame
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – Seven Indianapolis Colts, including several franchise icons, are among the 128 Modern-Era candidates for the Pro Football Hall of Fame’s Class of 2026. At the top of the list, which was released Wednesday morning, are wide receiver Reggie Wayne and placekicker Adam Vinatieri, and they’re joined by two other long-time club standouts: defensive end Robert Mathis and center Jeff Saturday. items.title: Colts sign CB Hilton to practice squad; release WR Scott

Hilton is a familiar face for Colts defensive coordinator Lou Anarumo, who coached Hilton while serving in the same position with the Cincinnati Bengals. The Colts signed [...]

items.title: Michael Pittman Jr./Jonathan Taylor connection still fueling Colts

Led the league in rushing with a club-record 1,811 yards and total yards from scrimmage in ’21. Two Pro Bowl selections. One of five [...]

items.title: 5 Colts Things: Daniel Jones keeps avoiding sacks, wide receiver blocking unlocks offense's versatility, Tyler Warren makes an impact all over field, Rigoberto Sanchez finally punts...one time
items.summary: The Colts thrashed the Tennessee Titans, 41-20, in Week 3 to improve to 3-0 on the 2025 season. Below are five key takeaways as the Colts' torrid start to the year continued in Nashville.

items.title: Colts expected to sign veteran CB Mike Hilton; awaiting word on Kenny Moore II’s calf injury
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – The Indianapolis Colts are awaiting word on the severity of Kenny Moore II’s calf injury, but will take a step to ease any absence. The team will sign free agent cornerback Mike Hilton to the practice squad later Monday, according to a source with knowledge of the situation. Hilton, 31, will be reunited [...]

items.title: Around the AFC South: Texans drop to 0-3 with loss to Jaguars
items.summary: The Colts improved to 3-0 with their win over the Titans on Sunday.

items.title: Colts enter NFL history books with one punt in first three games of 2025
items.summary: The Colts are the first team to punt only once in the first three games of an NFL season since at least 1940.

items.title: Colts Blue Zone Podcast 426: Colts Now 3-0 After Dominant Win Over Titans
items.summary: The Indianapolis Colts improved to 3-0 after a dominant road win against the Tennessee Titans. Matt Adams looks at notable developments from the game, including Kenny Moore's return TD, Jonathan Taylor's backbreaking run and Daniel Jones' continued elevated play. Find the Colts Blue Zone on YouTube, Apple Podcasts or Spotify.

items.title: Michael Pittman Jr. on Colts’ 3-0 start: ‘We thought we were this team'
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS — It was business as usual Sunday in Nashville, Tennessee. Except for, that is, Anthony Richardson Sr. taking meaningful snaps for the first time this season and Rigoberto Sanchez finally launching a punt that’s in the official box score. “It was a helluva punt,’’ Shane Steichen said of Sanchez’s first punt after 19 consecutive [...]

items.title: 'There's nobody else playing like him:' Jonathan Taylor continues punishing start to 2025 in Colts' win over Titans
items.summary: Jonathan Taylor rushed for three touchdowns in the Colts' 41-20 win over the Tennessee Titans in Week 3, and his 338 rushing yards over the first three games of 2025 broke a franchise record set by Eric Dickerson 38 years ago.

items.title: NFL Week 3 is full of trap games; that the Colts didn't just avoid one, but blew out the Titans, might say a lot about this team
items.summary: The Colts preached focus and discipline leading up to Sunday's trip to Nashville to face the Tennessee Titans – and left with a 41-20 thumping of their AFC South rival, improving to 3-0 on the season.

items.title: 'Lightning in a bottle:' How Kenny Moore II's pick-six set tone in Colts' emphatic win over Titans
items.summary: The cornerback’s pick-six on Sunday was the fourth of his career.

items.title: Colts dominate Titans, 41-20, to improve to 3-0
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS — The Indianapolis Colts took the lead three plays into their AFC South matchup with the Tennessee Titans in Nashville on Sunday afternoon and never looked back, winning 41-20 and improving to 3-0 to start the season. Defensive back Kenny Moore II intercepted Titans' rookie quarterback Cam Ward on the third play from scrimmage [...]

items.title: Jonathan Taylor, Colts roll past Titans; improve to 3-0 for first time since 2009
items.summary: The Colts blew out the Tennessee Titans, 41-20, on Sunday at Nissan Stadium to improve to 3-0 on the 2025 season.
